name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
4. If the referendum is approved by the people of Puerto Rico, Congress shall ratify their choice.

Our bill is status-agnostic. If after undergoing the process, the triumphant option is statehood, we will not oppose.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
2. A 'bilateral negotiating commission' consisting of several Congress members & the presidential administration will provide advice to the delegates.

3. A referendum vote will then be held on the island to allow Puerto Ricans to vote on the delegates' recommendations.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
Here's how self-determination would work: 

1. Puerto Ricans elect delegates to a 'status convention,' where they come up with a solution for the island‚Äôs territorial status - whether that be statehood, independence, a free association or anything other than its current status.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
5. A process of self-determination, and specifically the bill we put forward, was informed and driven by grassroots groups on the Island.

It's also supported by more than 80 progressive groups across the country.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
4. The issue of D.C. & Puerto Rican statehood are not the same. 

Puerto Rico was annexed as a colony in 1898. Puerto Ricans have a distinct cultural identity and the island has fought against colonization since it was acquired by the Spanish.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
3. Congress imposing any one option on Puerto Rico would be the culmination of colonization. 

Choosing for the Puerto Rican people rather than letting them determine their own fate.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
A 2017 statehood ballot referendum had 23% voter turnout (it's usually 80%) after a boycott by all opposition political parties. 

The 2020 referendum got 52% support, but asked a single yes-or-no question: Should P.R. become a state? Which is not representative of other options.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
We support a process of self-determination for Puerto Rico. Why? 

1. Statehood isn't the only option. There's also independence or free association. 

2. It's not clear which of these options a majority of Puerto Ricans support. 

(1/7)

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
What is being done to increase vaccine supply? 

The U.S. just purchased 200M more doses, a 50% supply increase.

As of this week, the federal government is also sending doses directly to retail pharmacies.  In NYC, those doses are for ages 65+. More at https://t.co/aXnIuBWUgl.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
The next eligible group is people with preexisting conditions. When can they schedule their vaccinations?

You can call on 2/14 but you wont be scheduled until 2/15. See here for eligible conditions & required documentation: https://t.co/9iE2aAhmkT

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
Are vaccines safe? And are they still effective given the new COVID variants?

Overwhelmingly yes.  Numerous studies have found the vaccine to be safe & effective against various COVID-19 strains. Those prone to severe allergic reactions should speak with their doctor.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
How do I schedule a vaccine? 

For City-run sites, including Citi Field, go to https://t.co/aXnIuBWUgl or call 1-800-VAX-NYC4 

For State-run sites, go to https://t.co/WprTwHt1V5 or call 1-833-NYS-4-VAX 

For Yankee Stadium, go to https://t.co/9yZNei3ZjG, 1-833-SOMOSNY

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
How much do vaccines cost?

Vaccines are free of charge.

Do I still have to wear a mask after I get the vaccine?

Yes! Experts need more time to understand the protection that COVID-19 vaccines provide before deciding to change recommendations on mask use or social distancing.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
What is being done to increase vaccine sites in NY-14? 

We worked to bring a temporary site to First Baptist Church of E. Elmhurst, serving 500+. We have also identified for the state other possible temporary sites, including the NY Hall of Science and Lehman High School Campus.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text:
This week, we held a town hall on the COVID vaccine. Here were some of the FAQs:

Who's eligible?

The groups listed here are eligible regardless of documentation status. No immigration nor citizenship information will be taken at the vaccine site. https://t.co/r10D6WtHPf

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text: Today, we honor our veterans by remembering all that they sacrificed to protect our lives. As a Member of Congress, @RepAOC commits above all else to recognizing the urgent needs of our veteran community: the need for respect, dignity, opportunity, and liberty.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text: Returning service members must have basic needs met, like housing, healthcare and mental healthcare. We must do more to facilitate smooth transitions to civilian life. And, we must stop sending our children to combat without securing these protections and safeguards first.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text: .@RepAOC is also committed to fighting for veterans' needs in Congress. In her first term, the House passed nearly 100 bills to support veterans, including bills to address the backlog at the VA, and provide suicide prevention support and dental care. We now must do more.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text: Our office is ready to assist veterans who reside in NY-14. We are uniquely equipped to engage the Department of Veterans Affairs, VA hospitals, and any other federal agency. NY-14 veterans can contact our office by phone or through our website at https://t.co/jXHMCCprRR.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text: On this Veterans Day, @RepAOC would like to extend a special thank you to our veterans and their families for their service and their sacrifice. Every day, we are indebted to them as we enjoy the life, liberty, and pursuit of happiness that they so valiantly defended.

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text: 'I requested a mail-in ballot more than a month in advance of the primary election. I did not receive the ballot until the day before the actual election, so I decided to vote in person instead, which was risky since NYC's numbers were still relatively high.' (6/6)

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text: 'My building pays rent by mailling our checks to the landlord. Now, those checks are taking longer & longer to clear. Our landlord's been patient, but how many others will see a late rent check as an excuse to evict a tenant when the moratorium is over?' (5/6)

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text: 'I rely on USPS for my small business. In the past month, several packages never arrived to customers, even with tracking. The mailboxes outside my local post office have also sometimes been locked.' (4/6)

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text: 'Medication was mailed on 7/20 and a month later it has not yet arrived. The tracking shows no updates since 7/28. I had to request a replacement shipment, which arrived but not before I had to buy a small quantity of the medication out of pocket.' (3/6)

name: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
tweet_text: 'In late June, we sent time-sensitive notarized legal documents by priority mail. They never arrived and they appear to still be sitting in a distribution center. We had to travel to another state to re-sign and re-notarize the documents in person at the lawyer's office.' (2/6)
